{"step_by_step_thinking": "Socio-economic indicators are measures that reflect the social and economic conditions of a population. To determine which one of the following is NOT a socio-economic indicator, we need to understand the nature of each option. A. Literacy rate is a measure of the percentage of people in a population who can read and write. This is a socio-economic indicator as it reflects the educational level and opportunities within a society. B. Life expectancy at birth is a measure of the average number of years a newborn is expected to live. This is also a socio-economic indicator as it reflects the overall health and well-being of a population. C. Housing refers to the availability, quality, and affordability of housing options within a society. This is also a socio-economic indicator as it reflects the living conditions and standards of a population. D. Family size refers to the number of individuals in a household. While family size can have social and economic implications, it is not typically considered a direct socio-economic indicator. Therefore, the answer is D. Family size.", "answer_choice": "D"}
